title: Toast Notification API Contract
description: API contract for toast notification functions in the ElevenLabs TTS Chrome Extension (Phase 2: Text Selection and Context Menu Integration)

ToastConfig.description: Configuration object for creating a toast notification

message.description: The text content to display in the toast. Will be HTML-escaped automatically.
examples: Text captured: The quick brown fox jumps...
Text is very long (8,450 chars), this may take a while
Failed to capture text. Please try again.

type.description: Toast type for visual styling. Affects background color.

duration.description: How long to display the toast in milliseconds before auto-removing

position.description: Screen position where toast should appear

ToastElement.description: Return type of showToast function. Represents the toast container element with shadow root.

container.description: The host element for the shadow DOM (HTMLDivElement)

remove.description: Method to manually remove the toast before duration expires

functions.name: showToast
functions.description: Creates and displays a toast notification with the specified configuration. The toast is injected into the page DOM using Shadow DOM for style isolation and automatically removed after the specified duration.

parameters.name: config
parameters.description: Configuration object for the toast notification

returns.description: An object containing the toast container element and a remove method for manual cleanup

throws.message: Toast message is required and must not be empty
Cannot show toast: document.body is not available

sideEffects: Creates a new div element and appends it to document.body
Creates a shadow root in closed mode
Sets a timeout to automatically remove the toast after duration
HTML-escapes the message to prevent XSS

examples.description: Show success toast with default duration (3 seconds)
Show warning toast for long text
Show error toast with manual removal

implementation.testing: Manual testing in Chrome browser on 10+ websites

functions.name: removeToast
functions.description: Manually removes a toast notification from the DOM before its duration expires. This is useful for programmatically dismissing toasts (e.g., when user navigates away from page).

parameters.name: toastElement
parameters.description: The toast element returned by showToast()

sideEffects: Removes the toast container from document.body
Clears any pending timeout for auto-removal
Shadow root is automatically cleaned up when container is removed

implementation.note: In practice, toastElement.remove() can be called directly. This function is provided for API completeness.

styling.description: Toast notifications are styled using CSS injected into the shadow root. This ensures complete isolation from page styles.

accessibility.screenReaderSupport: Toast content is announced by screen readers due to role='alert' and aria-live='polite'
accessibility.visualContrast: High contrast white text on colored backgrounds (WCAG AA compliant)
accessibility.timing: 3-second duration provides adequate time to read short messages

security.xssPrevention: All message content is HTML-escaped using textContent assignment before display
security.shadowDomMode: closed (prevents page JavaScript from accessing shadow root)
security.cspCompliance: Inline styles in shadow root do not violate Content Security Policy

limitations.maxToastsAtOnce: No limit enforced in Phase 2. Multiple toasts will stack vertically.
limitations.queueing: Not implemented in Phase 2. New toast appears immediately regardless of existing toasts.
limitations.userDismissal: Not implemented in Phase 2. Toasts auto-remove after duration; no close button.
limitations.persistence: Toasts are not persisted. Removed if page reloads or navigates.
limitations.customization: Position and duration can be configured, but colors are fixed per type in Phase 2.

unit: Verify default values are applied when not specified
integration: Verify toast appears on all test websites (10+)
Verify page styles don't affect toast appearance
Verify toast appears above all page content (z-index)
Verify no console errors on sites with CSP
accessibility: Verify screen reader announces toast (test with NVDA/VoiceOver)
Verify keyboard focus is not stolen by toast

phase3: Add close button for manual dismissal
Add toast queue (show one at a time)
Add progress indicator for long-running operations

examples.scenario: Phase 3: TTS API call in progress

notes.implementation: content.js implements showToast() and removeToast(). toast.css is injected into manifest.json content_scripts.
notes.messageFlow: Service worker sends SHOW_TOAST message â†’ Content script calls showToast()
notes.cleanup: Toasts are automatically cleaned up after duration. No memory leaks expected.
notes.performance: Shadow DOM overhead is minimal (~2ms). No impact on page performance.
notes.testing: Manual testing on 10+ popular websites ensures cross-site compatibility.
